Review: I feel like my rational self would simply give this a 4.5 but let me tell you I swooned so hard and enjoyed this much more than I thought it would.
Bumped up to a five stars.
A brilliant, deeply personal character study that never felt self-congratulatory in its telling. Always a sucker for reflective films.
all i can say is: juliette. binoche.
how do i give this film 10 stars out of 5

Movie: Portrait of a Lady on Fire
Review: Adele and Noemi tread the balance between calm and tension perfectly throughout the film. I caught myself carefully watching the details, as if I myself were tasked to paint a portrait as I was watching the movie.
It warms your heart and tears it apart. Ultimately, leaving one with fragments of hope that one may or may not realize.
Have you ever just randomly picked up a book, knowing nothing about it, then just being pleasantly surprised throughout the experience of reading it?
Have you ever encountered a film that just left you in awe? floored you? a bubble of overwhelming emotions waiting to burst?

Movie: The Tale of the Princess Kaguya
